name: Khadija El Merahy
profile: Second-year engineering student in Information Systems and Big Data at the National School of Applied Sciences of Berrechid. Curious and motivated, with a strong interest in data analysis, machine learning, and visualization. Seeking a Data Science internship to apply and deepen her skills.

education.institution: National School of Applied Sciences, Berrechid
education.degree: Engineering cycle in Information Systems and Big Data
details: Second year of the engineering cycle
Two years of integrated preparatory cycle

education.degree: Baccalaureate in Physical Sciences, French Option

missions: Design and development of RDS DataX, an agent-based intelligent data analysis system
Extraction and transformation of data from a MySQL database
Natural language interaction to answer user queries
Using Power BI to create a dynamic report
Strengthening skills in data engineering, data science, BI visualization, and AI agent integration

projects.name: Telecommunications Network Analysis and Optimization
projects.description: Academic project aiming to analyze and optimize a telecommunications network. Implementation of a graph-oriented database, community modeling with the Walktrap algorithm, and community identification to improve the preventive management of complex infrastructures.

projects.name: Library Management Application Development (SmartLib)
projects.description: Comprehensive Java application to manage a university library: management of books, students, borrowings, late penalties, and usage statistics. MVC architecture with CRUD functionalities and dynamic searches.

projects.name: E-commerce Platform Saphir Jewelry
projects.description: E-commerce platform dedicated to jewelry sales, featuring an interactive catalog, shopping cart, favorites management, and authentication. Responsive design with client-side data management via localStorage.

certifications.title: Data Science and Machine Learning — Python MasterClass
content: Mastery of Python libraries (NumPy, Pandas, Matplotlib, Seaborn, Scikit-Learn)
Data analysis, visualization, building ML algorithms (regression, classification, SVM, decision trees, Random Forest)
Practical projects including feature engineering, handling missing data, cross-validation
